channel.title: Custom Wep Problem
channel.description:
Alright, I'm stumped. I've made my own custom sword using Metasequoia. I've put it into the client correctly, but when I wield it, it looks good on one side, but glitchy on the other. I've done everything I can think of, but I'm not sure if it's the model or ints or whatever. Can someone help?
Here's pics of it in Metasequoia: [IMG]http://i32.tinypic.com/zsq2ic.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i28.tinypic.com/10hlj5f.jpg[/img]
Now here's pics of it in the client. Notice how one side looks okay, but the other has a bunch of black specs and is kind of glitchy: [IMG]http://i28.tinypic.com/2hd0k1c.gif[/img]
[IMG]http://i25.tinypic.com/e5o4gi.gif[/img]

item.title: Custom Wep Problem
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

All I can think of is that you either improperly material colored it, or that there’d an entirely black “side” of the sword in the same spot.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Wep Problem
item.dc:creator: @AlexDGr8r AlexDGr8r
item.description:
@AlexDGr8r wrote:

Alright, I’m kind of figuring it out now. I uncheck cull faces and I see all the black areas. What might this mean and how can I fix it?

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Wep Problem
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“AlexDGr8r, post:6, topic:292079”]I did trianglulate the faces. I’ve done all that is necessary to insert a model into a client properly. Still the same problem.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 31, 2009, 11:22:09 am[/size][hr]Are my ints correct?

if(i == 12001) // Your desired item id (the one you use after ::pickup ##### #) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; // String name, this can be changed to wield, or attach, or whatever you want class8.anInt174 = 12002; // Drop/Inv Model class8.anInt165 = 12001; // Male Wield Model class8.anInt200 = 12001; // Female Wield class8.anInt188 = -1; // Male arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used) class8.anInt164 = -1; // Female arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used) class8.anInt181 = 800; // Zoom - Increase to make inv model smaller class8.anInt190 = 498; // Rotate up/down - Increase to rotate upwards class8.anInt198 = 1300; // Rotate right/left - Increase to rotate right class8.anInt169 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move right class8.anInt194 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move up class8.aString170 = "Fargen's Sword"; // Item Name class8.aByteArray178 = "Fargen's Masterly Crafted Sword".getBytes(); // Item Examine }[/quote]
That problem would never be caused by ints. Ints will NEVER cause model problems.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Wep Problem
item.dc:creator: @AlexDGr8r AlexDGr8r
item.description:
@AlexDGr8r wrote:

I did trianglulate the faces. I’ve done all that is necessary to insert a model into a client properly. Still the same problem.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 31, 2009, 11:22:09 am[/size][hr]Are my ints correct?

if(i == 12001) // Your desired item id (the one you use after ::pickup ##### #) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; // String name, this can be changed to wield, or attach, or whatever you want class8.anInt174 = 12002; // Drop/Inv Model class8.anInt165 = 12001; // Male Wield Model class8.anInt200 = 12001; // Female Wield class8.anInt188 = -1; // Male arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used) class8.anInt164 = -1; // Female arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used) class8.anInt181 = 800; // Zoom - Increase to make inv model smaller class8.anInt190 = 498; // Rotate up/down - Increase to rotate upwards class8.anInt198 = 1300; // Rotate right/left - Increase to rotate right class8.anInt169 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move right class8.anInt194 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move up class8.aString170 = "Fargen's Sword"; // Item Name class8.aByteArray178 = "Fargen's Masterly Crafted Sword".getBytes(); // Item Examine }

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Wep Problem
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

Triangluate the faces. Press Select all, then go to Selected > triangulate selected faces

item.title: Custom Wep Problem
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Screen shots are good, you probably didn’t put the correct priority. needs 10 (and Don’t check the checkbox)
